history.proof: intros A B X Y f H. intros x Hx. unfold respectful_set. unfold respectful_set in Hx. apply H. apply Hx.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A B : Type) (X Y : Ensemble B) (f : A -> B), Included X Y -> Included (respectful_set X f) (respectful_set Y f)

Premises:
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For Cj: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For D: Arguments TA,
respectful_set = fun (A B : Type) (X : Ensemble B) (f : A -> B) (x : A) => X (f x) : forall A B : Type, Ensemble B -> (A -> B) -> Ensemble A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ function_scope]
Included = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Strict_Included_intro : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y /\ X <> Y -> Strict_Included U X Y
image_set_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Ensemble A -> (A -> B) -> B -> Prop), (forall (X : Ensemble A) (f : A -> B) (x : A), X x -> P X f (f x)) -> forall (e : Ensemble A) (y : A -> B) (y0 : B), image_set e y y0 -> P e y y0
fin_subset_match : forall (X : Ensemble ?A) (Y : Ensemble ?B), (forall x : ?A, X x -> exists y : ?B, ?P x y /\ Y y) -> forall xs : list ?A, List.Forall (fun x : ?A => X x) xs -> exists ys : list ?B, List.Forall2 ?P xs ys /\ List.Forall (fun y : ?B => Y y) ys where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type] ?P : [ |- ?A -> ?B -> Prop]
Inductive image_set (A B : Type) : Ensemble A -> (A -> B) -> Ensemble B := image_set_intro : forall (X : Ensemble A) (f : A -> B) (x : A), X x -> image_set X f (f x) For image_set: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For image_set_intro: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For image_set: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ function_scope] For image_set_intro: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ function_scope _ _]
image_set_intro : forall (X : Ensemble ?A) (f : ?A -> ?B) (x : ?A), X x -> image_set X f (f x) where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]
Intersection_absort_left : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Included B A -> Same_set (Intersection U A B) B
Intersection_absort_right : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Included A B -> Same_set (Intersection U A B) A
Inhabited_not_empty : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U), Inhabited U X -> X <> Empty_set U
respectful_set_proper = fun (A B : Type) (x y : Ensemble B) (H : Same_set x y) (x0 y0 : A -> B) (H0 : pointwise_relation A eq x0 y0) => (fun lemma : Same_set (respectful_set x x0) (respectful_set y y0) <-> pointwise_relation A iff (respectful_set x x0) (respectful_set y y0) => iff_flip_impl_subrelation (Same_set (respectful_set x x0) (respectful_set y y0)) (pointwise_relation A iff (respectful_set x x0) (respectful_set y y0)) lemma) (Same_set_spec A (respectful_set x x0) (respectful_set y y0)) (fun a : A => conj (fun H1 : x (x0 a) => (fun lemma : x (y0 a) <-> y (y0 a) => iff_flip_impl_subrelation (y (y0 a)) (x (y0 a)) (symmetry lemma)) ((fun lemma : Same_set x y <->...
Strict_Included_strict : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U), ~ Strict_Included U X X
image_set_spec : forall (f : ?A -> ?B) (X : Ensemble ?A) (y : ?B), image_set X f y < -> (exists x : ?A, X x /\ y = f x) where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]
Included_Disjoint : forall (A : Type) (P Q P' Q' : Ensemble A), Included P P' -> Included Q Q' -> Disjoint A P' Q' -> Disjoint A P Q
List.Forall2_cons : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> List.Forall2 R l l' -> List.Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l')
Decidable.dec_and : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> Decidable.decidable B -> Decidable.decidable (A /\ B)
Decidable.not_and : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> ~ (A /\ B) -> ~ A \/ ~ B
Setminus_intro : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U A x -> ~ In U B x -> In U (Setminus U A B) x
BinPos.Pos.iter_invariant : forall (p : BinNums.positive) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (Inv : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, Inv x -> Inv (f x)) -> forall x : A, Inv x -> Inv (BinPos.Pos.iter f x p)
Included_Empty : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U), Included (Empty_set U) A
Included_trans : forall P Q R : Ensemble ?A, Included P Q -> Included Q R -> Included P R where ?A : [ |- Type]
Same_set = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => Included B C /\ Included C B : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Complement_Included_rev : forall (U : Type) (P Q : Ensemble U), Included P Q -> Included (Complement U Q) (Complement U P)
Extensionality_Ensembles : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Same_set A B -> A = B
Included_Complement_Disjoint : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Included P (Complement A Q) < -> Disjoint A P Q
Included_refl : forall (A : Type) (P : Ensemble A), Included P P
Included_Full_set : forall (A : Type) (P : Ensemble A), Included P (Full_set A)
Intersection2_Included : forall P Q R : Ensemble ?A, Included Q R -> Included (Intersection ?A P Q) R where ?A : [ |- Type]
Intersection1_Included : forall P Q R : Ensemble ?A, Included P R -> Included (Intersection ?A P Q) R where ?A : [ |- Type]
List.Forall2_nil : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop), List.Forall2 R nil nil
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Union_iff : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U (Union U A B) x < -> In U A x \/ In U B x
Inductive Forall2 (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) : list A -> list B -> Prop := Forall2_nil : List.Forall2 R nil nil | Forall2_cons : forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> List.Forall2 R l l' -> List.Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l') For Forall2: Arguments A, B are implicit For Forall2_nil: Arguments A, B are implicit For Forall2_cons: Arguments A, B, R, l, l' are implicit For Forall2: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope list_scope list_scope] For Forall2_nil: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope] For Forall2_cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _ _ list_scope list_scope _ _]
Union_Included : forall P Q R : Ensemble ?A, Included (Union ?A P Q) R < -> Included P R /\ Included Q R where ?A : [ |- Type]
BinPosDef.Pos.iter = fun (A : Type) (f : A -> A) => fix iter_fix (x : A) (n : BinNums.positive) {struct n} : A := match n with | BinNums.xI n' => f (iter_fix (iter_fix x n') n') | BinNums.xO n' => iter_fix (iter_fix x n') n' | BinNums.xH => f x end : forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> A -> BinNums.positive -> A Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ positive_scope]
Inhabited_ind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
Inhabited_sind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
List.Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), List.Forall P nil
Disjoint_spec : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Disjoint A P Q < -> (forall x : A, P x -> Q x -> False)
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Intersection_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u
Intersection_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u

```coq
intros A B X Y f H.
intros x Hx.
unfold respectful_set.
simpl.
unfold respectful_set in Hx.
apply H.
apply Hx.
Qed.```
